statement:
If $A_i,B_i$ for $i=1,\ldots,5$ are objects in an abelian category (for
example, modules over a ring $R$) such that there is a commutative
diagram
$$\xymatrix{A_1\ar[r]\ar[d]^{\gamma_1}&A_2\ar[r]\ar[d]^{\gamma_2}&
A_3\ar[r]\ar[d]^{\gamma_3}&A_4\ar[r]\ar[d]^{\gamma_4}&A_5\ar[d]^{\gamma_5}\\
B_1\ar[r]&B_2\ar[r]&B_3\ar[r]&B_4\ar[r]&B_5}$$ with the rows exact, and
$\gamma_1$ is surjective, $\gamma_5$ is injective, and $\gamma_2$ and
$\gamma_4$ are isomorphisms, then $\gamma_3$ is an isomorphism as well.

A special case of this is the short 5-lemma, in which $A_1=A_5=B_1=B_5$
are the trivial objects of the category (hence the rows form short exact
sequences). In this case, we have that if $\gamma_2$ and $\gamma_4$ are
injective (resp. surjective, isomorphisms), then $\gamma_3$ is also
injective (resp. surjective, an isomorphism).
